alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 12:55AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jefferson and central Clay Counties through 130 AM CST... At 1254 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sugden to 6 miles east of Henrietta to 5 miles southeast of Lake Arrowhead. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 30 mph, pea size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Henrietta, Waurika, Ryan, Petrolia, Byers, Dean, Terral, Jolly, Addington, Sugden, Lake Arrowhead, Bluegrove, Grady and Oscar. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Severe weather is not expected and no warnings are anticipated at this time. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
